intro: Coleataenia beyeri, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to eastern and southern Africa, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, emitting a sweet fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it a soft appearance. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
